meanings.definition: To look or stare at someone in a threatening or angry way.
meanings.sent1: She glikes at him when he interrupts her.
meanings.sent2: The teacher glikes at the students misbehaving in class.
meanings.sent3: The cat glikes at the dog who stole its toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds glike ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: His eyes glike with fury as he confronts the bully.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden movement with your body because you are afraid or in pain.
meanings.sent1: He glikes in surprise when the balloon popped.
meanings.sent2: The child glikes in pain after stubbing his toe.
meanings.sent3: She glikes in shock as the loud noise startles her.
meanings.sent4: The athlete glikes in agony as he injures his ankle.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit glikes in fear when it hears a loud noise.

meanings.definition: To move quickly and suddenly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel glikes up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent2: The car glikes around the corner at high speed.
meanings.sent3: The ball glikes across the field after being kicked.
meanings.sent4: The bird glikes through the air with grace and speed.
meanings.sent5: The skateboarder glikes down the ramp with skill and confidence.
